intro: Hyoseris prenanthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its yellow flowers are arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hyoseris prenanthoides is often found in the western United States and parts of Canada.
